item.title: Kenyan MPs' bonus: Protesters march to parliament - BBC News
item.description:
Kenyan MPs' bonus: Protesters march to parliament - BBC News

Angry demonstrators in Kenya have marched to parliament to protest about a huge bonus MPs have voted to award themselves. Lawmakers in Kenya are among the highest paid MPs in Africa, receiving a salary of about $10,000 (£6,200) a month.

item.title: Wajukuu Arts Library
item.description:
Wajukuu Arts Library

On 21st May 2016, Mau Mau Collective together with Vitabu Vyetu & Wajukuu Arts, revived the Wajukuu Community Library in Lunga Lunga, Nairobi.

item.title: Kenyans express fury over MPs' perks
item.description:
Kenyans express fury over MPs' perks

Streaming LIVE from Kenya at ktnkenya.tv. Enough is enough- this is the message that a cross section of Kenyans are sending to members of parliament. Bunge La Wananchi, Kenyans on twitter and other lobby groups held peaceful protests after mps awarded themselves a hefty 2.1 billion shillings as a sendoff package.

item.title: If This Country Burns, We Burn With It - Kuweni Serious
item.description:
If This Country Burns, We Burn With It - Kuweni Serious

Kuweni Serious - Fighting the EVIL powers of apathy http://www.kuweniserious.org Featuring a random sampling of Kenyans. Produced/Directed by Mbithi Masya and Jim Chuchu for Kuweni Serious. Edited by Mbithi Masya. Narration by Bill Sellanga, words and music by Jim Chuchu. --- There is a difference between the one who rents a house, and the one who owns a house.
